#!/bin/bash

# Define source and destination paths
source_file="hello_world.sh"
destination_dir="/root"

# Run the sudo command to copy the file
if sudo cp "$source_file" "$destination_dir" 2>/tmp/copy_error.log; then
    # Command succeeded, log success message to syslog
    logger -t "CopyFileScript" "Successfully copied $source_file to $destination_dir"
else
    # Command failed, capture error message from log file
    error_message=$(< /tmp/copy_error.log)
    # Log error message to syslog
    logger -t "CopyFileScript" "Error copying $source_file to $destination_dir: $error_message"
fi

# Clean up temporary error log file
rm -f /tmp/copy_error.log
